area.key: Select the item types the editor is allowed to create in or select from the library. Requires library to be configured.
Select the single use item types the editor is allowed to embed.

For layouts we assume that 100% of the space is available so for E.G. 1fr for each column will distribute the columns over that available space. 1f 2fr 1fr will make the second column twice as wide as the first and last using only the available space.

Areas represent spaces in your CSS grid layout. Column and row are represented as spans between lines. Example. Putting 2 in column and 1 in row will result in an area that spans from line 2 to 3 for the col and line 1 for the row to the next line.
You have selected a layout that holds less items
If you continue you may lose content. The new layout is not big enough to contain the number of items the previous layout contained
If you continue all changes to this layout will be lost

You have decided to convert a linked library item into an embedded item. If you proceed all properties will be mapped to the new locations. Be aware that if you have this wrong your data may end up in the wrong location.
While sorting is enabled you cannot set restrictions on allowed item types at the area level.
When enabled, areas in a layout can be sorted. NOTE: all areas will be configured to allow all of the below item types and area restrictions will not apply.
Select the content type (this is used to configure the layout settings for each bento layout).
No item types or reusable library types configured for this layout area
